intro: Henckelia wallichiana, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Henckelia wallichiana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
